title: How did depression influence Nietzsche's philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: His stuff is dark. Nietzsche's most famous quote is “God is dead. And we killed him.” That's not something that comes from someone who is happy. His view on aesthetics was that art's only real purpose was to distract from the everyday sadness in our lives. He argued that God only existed because people were delusional and held false hopes about life after their miserable lives. That doesn't sound like the work of someone who was happy with their life. Question: How did depression influence Nietzsche's philosophy?

His childhood traumatic experience with both of his parents and aunt left him a lot of repressed experience in unconscious, which later influence his perception about the world, humanity, and Christine, and above all his ideas in philosophy. Swiss psychologist, Alice Miller have wrote a chapter on her book tthe untouched key, nietzsche’s mental problem and the relationship between his childhood experience and his philosophical ideology.
